*div1 type="summary"* *p*James J. Ross to Austin, May 13, 1826. Report of an expedition against Waco Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="05-13-1826">May 13th 1826*/date_mentioned*—*/p* *p*Dear Sir. *person_mentioned*Capn Buckner*/person_mentioned* has not arrived yet but we expect him every minit I have had *person_mentioned*Spies */person_mentioned*out every day and night Since I Received your order and do expect to do so untill further orders and perhaps go with 20 or 30 *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*above the *location_mentioned*San Antonio Road*/location_mentioned* where it is soposed the *person_mentioned*Wacos */person_mentioned*may be hunting Though I think it immaginary. at all events it is our duty to keep a good look out—and if we Cannot hear from the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*in 8 or 10 days it may be best to discharge the men. as it is about the time those *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*leaves their *location_mentioned*villages */location_mentioned*to go a hunting—
*/p**p*The[y] genneraly Return when their Corn gets in Roasting Ears and their Water Mellons gits Ripe then I do think would be the best time to find them at *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*and as good a time to go a Campaign as any—I will see or hear from you before that time—*/p* *p*Yours Respectfully*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James J. Ross*/person_mentioned*—
*/p**p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colo Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
